message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest major depressive disorder, which is commonly associated with decreased serotonin and norepinephrine levels. Decreased GABA can lead to anxiety, which is not mentioned in this patient’s symptoms. Increased dopamine is more commonly associated with schizophrenia, and increased norepinephrine is more commonly associated with anxiety and panic disorders.
